subject: p14841168
History: Year old woman with sepsis of unknown etiology, worsening respiratory acidosis, pulmonary edema.
Findings: Portable semi-upright radiograph of the chest demonstrates a stable cardiomediastinal silhouette as seen on prior examinations, with mediastinal widening. An elevated right hemidiaphragm is again seen. The left lung base is not visualized. No focal consolidation is identified in the visualized lung fields. Given supine technique, it is difficult assess for pleural effusion or pneumothorax.
Impression: No significant change since recent prior.
